## RequestSlot interface

Information for a slot coming in on the request.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface RequestSlot<T = RequestSlotValues> 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [id](./stentor-models.requestslot.id.md) | string | ID of the slot, if applicable.<!-- -->For example, "UVA" |
|  [name](./stentor-models.requestslot.name.md) | string | The name of the slot, also used as the key in the RequestSlotMap.<!-- -->For example, "FIRST\_TEAM" or "Podcast", this is typically user defined. |
|  [original](./stentor-models.requestslot.original.md) | any | The original value provided by the NLU before normalization. |
|  [rawValue](./stentor-models.requestslot.rawvalue.md) | string | The raw spoken value.<!-- -->For example, "cavaliers" or "red" |
|  [successfulMatch](./stentor-models.requestslot.successfulmatch.md) | boolean | If the entity resolution was successful or not.<!-- -->See [https://developer.amazon.com/docs/custom-skills/define-synonyms-and-ids-for-slot-type-values-entity-resolution.html\#er-built-in-types](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/custom-skills/define-synonyms-and-ids-for-slot-type-values-entity-resolution.html#er-built-in-types) |
|  [value](./stentor-models.requestslot.value.md) | T | The slot normalized value.<!-- -->When leveraging synonyms, this will be the canonical value. If not then it is the same as the rawValue.<!-- -->For example, "University of Virginia" or "Red Wine". |
